articles.description: Access to biological samples raised flags for Zimbabwe as the US did not want to share the benefits of its research.

more.title: How the Skeleton of Mutapa Times is Based on Sarah Charlesworth's Work
more.description: Conceptual artist Sarah Charlesworth's 1979 study of how newspapers covered a solar eclipse inspired the framework behind The Mutapa Times.

more.title: Open Society Condemns Deportation of Zimbabwean Lawyer Brian Kagoro From Kenya
more.description: Open Society Foundations Seek Clarification From Kenya Over Unlawful Expulsion Of Brian Kagoro The Open Society Foundations (OSF) has fiercely condemned the Kenyan government for the arbitrary detention and deportation of its Managing Director of Programmes, Brian Kagoro, a prominent Zimbabwean lawyer and Pan-Africanist, branding the move legally unfounded and a blatant violation of due [...]The post Open Society Condemns Deportation of Zimbabwean Lawyer Brian Kagoro From Kenya appeared first on iHarare News.

more.title: Bennett’s Brilliant 97 Not Enough as India Overpower Chevrons
more.description: By Kudzaishe Zvaguma Zimbabwe suffered a heavy 72-run defeat to India in their ICC Men’s T20 World Cup Super Eight clash despite a heroic batting display from Brian Bennett in Chennai on Thursday. more.title: Ethanol Blending a Strategic Asset Zim Must Promote

more.title: Mighty Warriors eye upset against Banyana Banyana
more.description: The Zimbabwe senior women’s team is hoping to record a win against South Africa on Friday in the COSAFA Cup semi-final to be played at Peter Mokaba Stadium. The Mighty Warriors are enjoying a good run in the tournament after finishing unbeaten in Group B, where they recorded 7 points, the same margin as Zambia, [...]The post Mighty Warriors eye upset against Banyana Banyana appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: ZWG annual inflation drops to 3,8%
more.description: Zimbabwe’s ZiG (ZWG) currency annual inflation rate declined to 3.8% in February 2026, while monthly inflation remained stable at 0.1%, according to the latest data released by the Zimbabwe National Statistics Agency (Zimstat). The latest figures reflect continued price stability under tight monetary policy measures, with the ZWG maintaining relative stability since late 2025. Analysts [...]The post ZWG annual inflation drops to 3,8% appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: ZANU PF cracks the whip
more.description: Samuel Kadungure News Editor ZANU PF Secretary-General, Advocate Jacob Mudenda, has urged party leaders to fully grasp their constitutional mandates and limits in order to prevent internal conflicts and foster disciplined leadership. Addressing the Provincial Coordinating Committee (PCC) meeting held in Mutare yesterday (Thursday), Advocate Mudenda underscored the importance of clarity in authority to avoid [...]The post ZANU PF cracks the whip appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: 2 500 jobs in US$260m Varun deal . . . President poised to open firm’s new beer, snacks-making plants
more.description: Debra Matabvu-Senior Reporter VARUN Beverages Ltd has invested more than US$260 million in new beer and snacks manufacturing plants, set to be officially opened by President Mnangagwa in the coming months, as the company expands its food and beverage portfolio in Zimbabwe. The investment is part of a broader wave of foreign direct commitment into [...]The post 2 500 jobs in US$260m Varun deal . . . President poised to open firm’s new beer, snacks-making plants appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: Insiza farmers begin early preparations for ZITF livestock showcase
more.description: Nqobile Bhebhe, nqobile.bhebhe@chronicle.co.zw FARMERS in Insiza District have begun preparations for this year’s Zimbabwe International Trade Fair (ZITF), with livestock producers already selecting and grooming animals for exhibition in what Government has described as a display of foresight and commercial discipline. Permanent Secretary in the Ministry of Lands, Agriculture, Fisheries, Water and Rural Development, Professor Obert [...]The post Insiza farmers begin early preparations for ZITF livestock showcase appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: Government steps in to revive Mzinyathini Irrigation Scheme
more.description: Nothando Zondo, cherrelncz@gmail.com GOVERNMENT and its partners have come to the rescue of Mzinyathini Irrigation Scheme in Umzingwane District, with upgrade works underway in a move expected to improve food security in the area. The 45-hectare scheme, established in 1956 and historically reliant on a canal system drawing water from Umzingwane Dam, had been idle for [...]The post Government steps in to revive Mzinyathini Irrigation Scheme appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: Rural dairy output rises as Presidential Silage Scheme bears fruit in Umzingwane
more.description: Nothando Zondo, cherrelncz@gmail.com GOVERNMENT efforts to industrialise rural communities through targeted dairy interventions are beginning to show tangible results in Mlomoliwoto, Umzingwane District. The Presidential Silage Inputs Scheme — introduced to improve both the quality and availability of livestock feed — has reshaped the local dairy sector by providing subsidised silage inputs, enabling farmers to maintain [...]The post Rural dairy output rises as Presidential Silage Scheme bears fruit in Umzingwane appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: Mentors with a mission: Empowering girls to fight HIV and the odds
more.description: Sukulwenkosi Dube-Matutu, sukulwenkosi.dube@chronicle.co.zw THE role of mentoring adolescent girls and young women is not one being taken lightly by National Aids Council (NAC) Sista2Sista programme mentors as it involves safeguarding the youngsters against ills such as HIV infection, teenage pregnancies and Sexually Transmitted Infections (STIs). Under the programme, ambassadors have been trained to mentor 50 adolescent [...]The post Mentors with a mission: Empowering girls to fight HIV and the odds appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: Teenage pregnancy in Mangwe: A tale of a people who have lost their collective soul
more.description: Father Hlakanipha Mbongolwane, hlaks1980@gmail.com MANGWE District in Matabeleland South Province is a rainbow district. While it is predominantly Kalanga-speaking, it is home to people from all walks of life. It is famed for amacimbi (mopane worms) and is strategically positioned with three borders — Matsilotje, Plumtree and Maitengwe. However, the district’s proximity to border points and [...]The post Teenage pregnancy in Mangwe: A tale of a people who have lost their collective soul appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: Councils fail to account for funds after ZINARA’s ZWG358 million disbursement for road maintenance
more.description: The Zimbabwe National Road Administration (ZINARA) disbursed over ZWG350 million to local authorities for road maintenance in 2025, but the lack of accountability by some councils has raised concerns over the utilisation of the funds. This was revealed by ZINARA Chief Executive Officer Nkosinathi Ncube during an appearance before the Parliamentary Portfolio Committee on Transport [...]The post Councils fail to account for funds after ZINARA’s ZWG358 million disbursement for road maintenance appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.
